tier.item: (9) Examples of case-marked nouns in Kamayurá (Seki 2000, 2001;
a. ok-ip i-ko-w b. ije rak morerekwar-am
`He is at home.' `I was (there) as a chief.'
(9) Examples of case-marked nouns in Kamayurá (Seki 2000, 2001;
a. ok-ip i-ko-w b. ije rak morerekwar-am
`He is at home.' `I was (there) as a chief.'
(9) Examples of case-marked nouns in Kamayurá (Seki 2000, 2001; glosses mine).
ok-ip i-ko-w b. ije rak morerekwar-am
He is at home.' `I was (there) as a chief.
`with my father' `(one who) was a chief'
`with my father' `(one who) was a chief'
with my father' `(one who) was a chief

`I know that it will bite me.'

j. a'e-a rak paku-a o-juka, myt, jakuaem
j. a'e-a rak paku-a o-juka, myt, jakuaem
a'e-a rak paku-a o-juka, myt, jakuaem
This (man) killed paca, (also) mutum (=curassow), (also) jacu (=bird sp.).
